We help the nigerian student learn how to code

Find Out More

We believe there are no boundaries!

At Codes without Borders, we are fully commited to raising Nigeria's next generation of Programmers, if there was ever one. We believe in the unalienable right of access of the Nigerian child to, at least, basic useful computer science education, because we know as a matter of fact, that no matter their eventual chosen career, computers and technology will play a central role. We believe that arming the young ones with adequate computer science education will go a long way in developing their critical thinking ability which is a neccessary prerequisite for nation building. We intend to achieve our aims, through raising awareness that every child can learn how to code regardless of what they eventually study in the university and building a strong advocacy for modernization of the computer science curriculum in Nigerian schools. We would be glad if you contribute to the cause.

Our Events

CWB Scratch Code Camp

This November, we are organizing a 5-weekend code camp for students in selected secondary schools from underserved areas in Lagos for FREE. The lessons will be given using Scratch - a programming learning environment for kids created by the lifelong kindergerten group at MIT.

Teach a Child!

We are looking for volunteers to help us teach our kids programming in the CWB Scratch Code Camp. You will be paired with a child from a secondary school in an underserved area and tutor them for five consecutive weekends - starting from the 5th of november. You will be trained for this programme, all we require from you is to have a laptop and your time (a couple of hours) on weekends. You will get a certificate acknowledging you volunteered, but most importantly, you will have fun, while being a part of a child's future.

Volunteer Now!

send us an email and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
